refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Ctrlproxy uses an XML file for configuration. Check the ctrlproxyrc.example file for a good example. There are a few so-called 'sections' in the file that are discussed below.

refsect2.title: plugins
refsect2.para: This section contains a list of all the plugins that are to be loaded. A <plugin> tag specifies a plugin. The 'file' attribute specifies the location the plugin can be found. Additional attributes or child elements can be specified, depending on the plugin.

refsect2.title: networks
refsect2.para: This section contains a list of all the servers to join. The <network> element supports the attributes: nick, username, fullname, type, pass.
pass contains the password to join the server. client_pass contains the password any client that connects to the proxy should send.
The <network> element supports the child element <channel>. Attributes of this element are name (indicating the name of the channel) and autojoin (whether or not to join the channel on start).
Each <network> element contains a <servers> element which contains several transport-specific elements. The standard 'socket' module provides the transports 'ipv4', 'ipv6' and 'pipe'.
